info.description:
This is the public REST API to integrate with the Cortex XSOAR server.
HTTP request can be sent using any HTTP-client.

For an example dedicated client take a look at: https://github.com/demisto/demisto-py.

Requests must include API-key that can be generated in the Cortex XSOAR web client under 'Settings' -> 'Integrations' -> 'API keys'


Optimistic Locking and Versioning\:

When using Cortex XSOAR REST API, you will need to make sure to work on the latest version of the item (incident, entry, etc.), otherwise, you will get a DB version error (which not allow you to override a newer item).
In addition, you can pass 'version\: -1' to force data override (make sure that other users data might be lost).

Assume that Alice and Bob both read the same data from Cortex XSOAR server, then they both changed the data, and then both tried to write the new versions back to the server. Whose changes should be saved? Alice’s? Bob’s?
To solve this, each data item in Cortex XSOAR has a numeric incremental version.
If Alice saved an item with version 4 and Bob trying to save the same item with version 3, Cortex XSOAR will rollback Bob request and returns a DB version conflict error.
Bob will need to get the latest item and work on it so Alice work will not get lost.

Example request using 'curl'\:

```
curl 'https://hostname:443/incidents/search' -H 'content-type: application/json' -H 'accept: application/json' -H 'Authorization: <API Key goes here>' --data-binary '{"filter":{"query":"-status:closed -category:job","period":{"by":"day","fromValue":7}}}' --compressed
```

post.description:
Create or update incident according to JSON structure.
To update incident custom fields you should lowercase them and remove all spaces. For example: Scan IP -> scanip
To get the actual key name you can also go to Cortex XSOAR CLI and run /incident_add and look for the key that you would like to update

Use the 'createInvestigation\: true' to start the investigation process automatically. (by running a playbook based on incident type.)

Create or update an incidents batch
To update incident custom fields you should lowercase them and remove all spaces. For example: Scan IP -> scanip
To get the actual key name you can also go to Cortex XSOAR CLI and run /incident_add and look for the key that you would like to update
Exports an incidents batch to CSV file (returns file ID)

Closes an incidents batch
To update incident custom fields you should lowercase them and remove all spaces. For example: Scan IP -> scanip
To get the actual key name you can also go to Cortex XSOAR CLI and run /incident_add and look for the key that you would like to update
Deletes an incidents batch

post.description:
Create indicators from raw JSON (similar to ingesting from a feed). Builds indicators according to the specified feed classifier,
or uses the default one if not specified.
Indicator properties (all optional except for value): **value** (string, required) | **type** (string) | **score** (number, 0-3,
default `0`, where `0` means None, `1` Good, `2` Suspicious, and `3` Bad) | **sourceBrand** (string, default `"External"`) | **sourceInstance**
(string, default `"External"`) | **reliability** (string, one of `"A - Completely reliable"`, `"B - Usually reliable"`, `"C - Fairly
reliable"`, `"D - Not usually reliable"`, `"E - Unreliable"`, `"F - Reliability cannot be judged"`) | **expirationPolicy** (string,
one of `"never"`, `"interval"`, `"indicatorType"`) | **expirationInterval** (number, in minutes)
Search indicators by filter

Get a given dashboard statistics result.
Deprecated - use "/v2/statistics/dashboards/query

200.description: Return an array of stats results for each widget cell in dashboard.

post.description:
Get a given widget object statistics result.
Note: This route has many return types based on the widget type and data. Each 200X represent a 200 OK request of specific widget type and data

Deprecated - use "/v2/statistics/widgets/query

200.description:
Response differ according to the widget type
  -  Incident data type of a "table" or "list" widget returns incidentSearchResponse
     total:
       type: integer
       data:
         type: array
      items:
        "$ref": "#/definitions/Incident"
    - Indicators data type of a "table" or "list" widget returns IoCsResponse
      total:
        type: integer
      data:
        type: array
        items:
          "$ref": "#/definitions/IocObject"
    - Number widget returns a simple number
      type: integer
    - Trend widget returns a trend object
      "$ref": "#/definitions/StatsTrendsResponse"
    - Text widget returns a text object, describing the final text and the placeholders values.
      "$ref": "#/definitions/StatsTextResponse"
    - A chart data array by groups. When requesting a date, the key is the date string, according to the specified time frame. Empty groups (dates) are also returned.
      type: array
      items:
        "$ref": "#/definitions/Group"

Get a given widget object statistics result.
Note: This route has many return types based on the widget type and data. Each 200X represent a 200 OK request of specific widget type and data

200.description:
Response differ according to the widget type
  -  Incident data type of a "table" or "list" widget returns incidentSearchResponse
     total:
       type: integer
       data:
         type: array
      items:
        "$ref": "#/definitions/Incident"
    - Indicators data type of a "table" or "list" widget returns IoCsResponse
      total:
        type: integer
      data:
        type: array
        items:
          "$ref": "#/definitions/IocObject"
    - Number widget returns a simple number
      type: integer
    - Trend widget returns a trend object
      "$ref": "#/definitions/StatsTrendsResponse"
    - Text widget returns a text object, describing the final text and the placeholders values.
      "$ref": "#/definitions/StatsTextResponse"
    - Line chart widget or Column chart widget returns StatsResponseWithReferenceLine
      "$ref": "#/definitions/StatsResponseWithReferenceLine"
    - A chart data array by groups. When requesting a date, the key is the date string, according to the specified time frame. Empty groups (dates) are also returned.
      type: array
      items:
        "$ref": "#/definitions/Group"

AdvanceArg.description:
Simple: plain text such as "hello" (constant) or ${File.ID} (DT expression)
Complex: struct with all info that is necessary to compute argument value from context (Root, Filters, Accessor & Transformers)]
KeyValue: list of key-value
AdvanceArg.title: AdvanceArg - advance argument can be one of the following:

ArgAtomicFilter.description: ArgAtomicFilter - operator with two sides that return true/false

ArgFilter.description: ArgFilter - represent a slice of atomic filters with OR condition between them (e.i. - atomic1 OR atomic2 OR ...)

Audit.description:
Audit holds the auditing details. This includes all common fields, the action in a string blob and the user who
performed the action in a user struct.

AutomationScript.description: AutomationScript represents a script that will run on  the system

dbotCreatedBy.description: Who has created this event - relevant only for manual incidents

dependsOn.description: This fields indicates which commands this script depends on

engine.description: Engine that will run the script

engineGroup.description: EngineGroup that will run the script

hasRole.description: Internal field to make queries on role faster

previousRoles.description: Do not change this field manually

roles.description: The role assigned to this investigation

BaseFilter.description: BaseFilter provides common fields used by most filters such as paging, sizing and sorting

Bucket.title: Bucket - represents a specific condition term for merging groups into a custom group.

Buckets.title: Buckets - Array of conditional buckets, related by 'OR'

CommentType.title: CommentType - comment type: regular comment, time-line, etc...

CommonFields.description: CommonFields holds the common fields to all entities

ComplexArg.description:
ComplexArg - all info that is necessary to compute argument value from context
Root - the root slice (or object) from to work against
Filters - a slice of filters to apply to the root object, one after another (e.i. with AND condition between each one)
Accessor - the key to access to each result after filter
Transformers - a slice to transformers to apply on the result of the accessed key from each result
e.g. if user want to take from context all File.DisplayName where File.Extension is 'EXE', and the result in uppercase than:
Root: is "File"
Filters: will hold the "File.DisplayName where File.Extension is 'EXE'" query
Accessor: is "DisplayName"
Transformers: will hold the uppercase transformation

ConfigDataType.description: ConfigDataType holds the type of a configuration field or command argument

roles.description: The role assigned to this investigation

The keys should be the field's display name all lower and without spaces. For example: Scan IP -> scanip
To get the actual key name you can also go to Cortex XSOAR CLI and run /incident_add and look for the key that you would like to update

scoreChangeTimestamp.description: We need to track when the score changes to know if we need to re-calculate the overall score

Duration.description:
A Duration represents the elapsed time between two instants
as an int64 nanosecond count. The representation limits the
largest representable duration to approximately 290 years.

ignoreWorkers.description: Do not use workers mechanism while searching bleve

searchAfter.description: Efficient next page, pass max sort value from previous page

searchAfterElastic.description: Efficient next page, pass max ES sort value from previous page

searchAfterMap.description:
Map accounts search after values - stores next page sort values per account.
There is no need to store searchBeforeMap as [current page searchBefore] equals to [prev page searchAfter]
More, there is no way to generate correct searchBefore from current page as some tenants may not appear at all.
The map is relevant in proxy mode and used by tenants, each tenant extracts the searchAfter keys from the map.

searchBefore.description: Efficient prev page, pass min sort value from next page

searchBeforeElastic.description: Efficient prev page, pass min ES sort value from next page

size.description: Size is limited to 1000, if not passed it defaults to 0, and no results will return

dbotMirrorLastSync.description: The last time we synced this incident even if we did not update anything

dbotMirrorTags.description: The entry tags I want to sync to remote system

details.description: The details of the incident - reason, etc.

feedBased.description: If this incident was triggered by a feed job

hasRole.description: Internal field to make queries on role faster

investigationId.description: Investigation that was opened as a result of the incoming event

labels.description: Labels related to incident - each label is composed of a type and value

lastJobRunTime.description: If this incident was triggered by a job, this would be the time the **previous** job started

linkedIncidents.description: LinkedIncidents incidents that were marked as linked by user

notifyTime.description: Incdicates when last this field was changed with a value that supposed to send a notification

occurred.description: When this incident has really occurred

owner.description: The user who owns this incident

playbookId.description: The associated playbook for this incident

previousRoles.description: Do not change this field manually

rawCloseReason.description: The reason for closing the incident (select from existing predefined values)

reminder.description: When if at all to send a reminder

roles.description: The role assigned to this investigation

todoTaskIds.description: ToDoTaskIDs list of to do task ids

Incidents.description: Incidents is a list of incident entities

IndicatorFilter.description: IndicatorFilter is a general filter that fetches entities using a query string query using the Query value

ignoreWorkers.description: Do not use workers mechanism while searching bleve

prevPage.description: MT support - these fields are for indicator search according to calculatedTime

searchAfter.description: Efficient next page, pass max sort value from previous page

searchAfterElastic.description: Efficient next page, pass max ES sort value from previous page

searchAfterMap.description:
Map accounts search after values - stores next page sort values per account.
There is no need to store searchBeforeMap as [current page searchBefore] equals to [prev page searchAfter]
More, there is no way to generate correct searchBefore from current page as some tenants may not appear at all.
The map is relevant in proxy mode and used by tenants, each tenant extracts the searchAfter keys from the map.

searchBefore.description: Efficient prev page, pass min sort value from next page

searchBeforeElastic.description: Efficient prev page, pass min ES sort value from next page

size.description: Size is limited to 1000, if not passed it defaults to 0, and no results will return

InsightCache.description: InsightCache - map insight name to all its metadata, name will be case insensitive

InstanceClassifier.description: InstanceClassifier - classifies an incident from a specific brand

Investigation.description: A special investigation called playground is created for each user-project combination and is a private space for the researcher to play in.
Investigation.title: Investigation contains the investigation of a particular incident.

closingUserId.description: The user ID that closed this investigation

creatingUserId.description: The user ID that created this investigation

dbotCreatedBy.description: Who has created this event - relevant only for manual incidents

hasRole.description: Internal field to make queries on role faster

highPriority.description: HighPriority - tasks of this investigation should run in high priority

mirrorAutoClose.description: MirrorAutoClose will tell us to close the Chat Module channel if we close investigation

mirrorTypes.description:
MirrorTypes holds info about mirror direction and message type to be mirrored
message type can be either 'all' or 'chat'
direction can be either 'FromDemisto', 'ToDemisto' or 'Both' if this investigation is mirrored

name.description: The name of the investigation, which is unique to the project

openDuration.description: Duration from open to close time

parentInvestigation.description: ParentInvestigation - parent id, in case this is a child investigation of another investigation

persistentEntitlements.description: Persistent entitlement per tag. Empty tag will also return an entitlement

previousRoles.description: Do not change this field manually

roles.description: The role assigned to this investigation

slackMirrorAutoClose.description: DEPRECATED - DeprecatedSlackMirrorAutoClose will tell us to close the Slack channel if we close investigation

slackMirrorType.description:
DEPRECATED - DeprecatedSlackMirrorType holds info about mirror direction and message type to be mirror
message type can be either 'all' or 'chat'
direction can be either 'demisto2Slack', 'slack2Demisto' or 'both' if this investigation is mirrored to Slack

users.description: The users who share this investigation

InvestigationFilter.title: InvestigationFilter allows for very simple filtering.

ignoreWorkers.description: Do not use workers mechanism while searching bleve

searchAfter.description: Efficient next page, pass max sort value from previous page

searchAfterElastic.description: Efficient next page, pass max ES sort value from previous page

searchAfterMap.description:
Map accounts search after values - stores next page sort values per account.
There is no need to store searchBeforeMap as [current page searchBefore] equals to [prev page searchAfter]
More, there is no way to generate correct searchBefore from current page as some tenants may not appear at all.
The map is relevant in proxy mode and used by tenants, each tenant extracts the searchAfter keys from the map.

searchBefore.description: Efficient prev page, pass min sort value from next page

searchBeforeElastic.description: Efficient prev page, pass min ES sort value from next page

size.description: Size is limited to 1000, if not passed it defaults to 0, and no results will return

InvestigationPlaybook.description: InvestigationPlaybook is a wrapper for a linked list of Playbook tasks

ReplacedPlaybook.description: Indicate whether this playbook has new history during this session

dbotCreatedBy.description: Who has created this event - relevant only for manual incidents

hasRole.description: Internal field to make queries on role faster

pendingTasks.description: Tasks that are marked for running, but cannot yet run due to incomplete parents

previousRoles.description: Do not change this field manually

roles.description: The role assigned to this investigation

serverId.description: Holds the ID of the responsible cluster app server

startTaskId.description: FirstTask is the root task of the playbook

InvestigationPlaybookData.description: InvestigationPlaybookData returns all data of an investigation playbook, not including history

pendingTasks.description: Tasks that are marked for running, but cannot yet run due to incomplete parents

startTaskId.description: FirstTask is the root task of the playbook

InvestigationPlaybookState.description: InvestigationPlaybookState indicates the state of the running playbook

InvestigationPlaybookTask.description: InvestigationPlaybookTask is the Task in the playbook context as a node

comments.description: Whether this task had any comments or not

conditions.description: Conditions - optional list of conditions to run when task is conditional. we check conditions by their order (e.i. - considering the first one that satisfied)

ignoreWorker.description: Do not run this task in a worker

missingContentItem.description: content item which caused task to skip

nextPollingTime.description: NextPollTime Time of the next scheduled command execution

parentBlockCount.description: the number of tasks that are waiting on blocked in subplaybooks of this task

patched.description: Indicates whether this task was patched to InvPB and did not originally belong to the playbook

pollingEntries.description: PollingEntryIDs IDs of entries that are still polling

reminder.description: Duration in minutes, this field is not persisted here

skip.description:
Skip - if true then this task will be skipped and all the tasks which comes after this task and depend on it
will skip (WillNotExecute)

skipUnavailable.description:
SkipUnavailable if true then will check if automation exists, integration of that command is installed and
active or sub playbook exists in Demisto

InvestigationSearchResponse.description: InvestigationSearchResponse returns the response from the investigation search

Investigations.description: Investigations is a slice of investigation

IocObject.description: IocObject - represents an Ioc (or simply an indicator) object

calculatedTime.description: Do not set the fields bellow this line

LayoutAPI.description:
LayoutAPI - request sent from the client contains some or all
of the fields.

pos.description: Pos is the position of the term within the field, starting at 1

start.description: Start and End are the byte offsets of the term in the field

dontMapEventToLabels.description: DontMapEventToLabels by default we will map all the fields of the event to incident labels

ModuleConfiguration.description: ModuleConfiguration is the configuration parameters for a module

NotifyTimings.title: NotifyTimings - time control on notify items - retries max count and intervals.

Order.description: Order struct holds a sort field and the direction of sorting

description.description: Description is either a string or a map from string to interface

Period.title: Period holds the 'Period' query, such as last 3 days, last 6 hours, between 6 days from now until 3 days from now.

by.description: By is used for legacty, and if exists it will override ByTo and ByFrom

Playbook.description: Playbook is a collection of tasks

dbotCreatedBy.description: Who has created this event - relevant only for manual incidents

hasRole.description: Internal field to make queries on role faster

previousRoles.description: Do not change this field manually

roles.description: The role assigned to this investigation

taskIds.description:
auto generated field that will contain all task ids in this playbook
Needed for searching with bleve

PlaybookInputQuery.description: PlaybookInputQuery represents the playbook query input

conditions.description: Conditions - optional list of conditions to run when task is conditional. we check conditions by their order (e.i. - considering the first one that satisfied)

ignoreWorker.description: Do not run this task in a worker

skipUnavailable.description:
SkipUnavailable if true then will check if automation exists, integration of that command is installed and
active or sub playbook exists in Demisto

PlaybookView.description: PlaybookView represents the view in client of playbook graph

QueryState.description: QueryState represents the playbook query state

Question.title: Question - question for a form with a given type.

QuietMode.description: QuietMode quiet mode for playbook task

RBAC.description: RBAC holds roles data for domain entities

dbotCreatedBy.description: Who has created this event - relevant only for manual incidents

hasRole.description: Internal field to make queries on role faster

previousRoles.description: Do not change this field manually

roles.description: The role assigned to this investigation

RawFeedIndicator.description: RawFeedIndicator is an unparsed feed indicator from JSON ingestion

RelationshipFilter.description: and within each parameter only one or more may match.
RelationshipFilter.title: RelationshipFilter allows filtering on relationship objects. All given parameters must match to return a result,

ignoreWorkers.description: Do not use workers mechanism while searching bleve

searchAfter.description: Efficient next page, pass max sort value from previous page

searchAfterElastic.description: Efficient next page, pass max ES sort value from previous page

searchAfterMap.description:
Map accounts search after values - stores next page sort values per account.
There is no need to store searchBeforeMap as [current page searchBefore] equals to [prev page searchAfter]
More, there is no way to generate correct searchBefore from current page as some tenants may not appear at all.
The map is relevant in proxy mode and used by tenants, each tenant extracts the searchAfter keys from the map.

searchBefore.description: Efficient prev page, pass min sort value from next page

searchBeforeElastic.description: Efficient prev page, pass min ES sort value from next page

size.description: Size is limited to 1000, if not passed it defaults to 0, and no results will return

ReputationData.description: ReputationData holds the reputation data (reputation, regex, highlights result)

SLADurationUnit.description: SLADurationUnit is a helper to calculate if SLA in hours or minutes

SLAState.description: SLAState is the incident sla at closure time

ScriptSubType.description: ScriptSubType holds the script type version

ScriptTarget.description: ScriptTarget represents the module where this script should run

ScriptType.description: ScriptType holds the type of a script

SearchStatsDeletionResponse.description: SearchStatsDeletionResponse returns the response from deleting old slow searches

SearchStatsResponse.description: SearchStatsResponse returns the response from getting slow searches

StatsQueryError.title: StatsQueryError - Describe the error returned related to a specific widget cell in a dashboard.

StatsQueryResponse.title: StatsQueryResponse - Describe the data returned related to a specific widget cell in a dashboard.

data.description: data array or object describing the statistics data based on type.

StatsQueryResponseWithError.title: StatsQueryResponseWithError - Describe the data returned related to a specific widget cell in a dashboard including errors.

StatsResponseWithReferenceLine.title: StatsResponseWithReferenceLine - Describe the data returned related to a specific Line/Column chart widget cell in a dashboard.

StatsScatterResponse.title: StatsScatterResponse - Represent a scatter response from statistics.

StatsTextResponse.title: StatsTextResponse - Describe the data returned related to a specific text widget cell in a dashboard.

text.description: Describe the complete text for the text widget, after placeholders injection.

StatsTrendsResponse.description:
StatsTrendsResponse - Represent a trend response from statistics. Provides information about
the current value and the previous value based on the period.

System.description: System - URL stands for ip or hostname

SystemAgent.description: SystemAgent - represents agent status and holds server context

Task.description: Task is the basic task in the task repository that can be associated to an incident via playbook

TaskCondition.description:
TaskCondition - contains a condition and a corresponding label
if the condition satisfied - its label is taken as the next task(s) input (e.i. the label on the edge)

TaskState.description: TaskState indicates the state of the task during the incident/investigation execution

TaskType.description: TaskType is the Task in the playbook context as a node

TaskView.description: TaskView represents the view in client of the tasks graph

TerminalOptions.description: TerminalOptions - terminal options to use in case of using pty

TypeAndKind.description: TypeAndKind - corresponding incident type & layout kind (details, edit, close, mobile...)

Unit42IndicatorLookup.description: Unit42IndicatorLookup - indicator lookup result from Unit42 intel

Unit42Session.title: Unit42Session - a unit42 session connected to a sample.

Digits.description:
WARNING: when adding new attributes or changing the names
of the existing ones, remember to add support in UnmarshalJSON
for items that were exported by msgpack.

Widget.description:
Widget describe a widget component used to get statistics requests, based on parameters such as
dataType and widgetType. A widget can be a part of widgets collection inside a dashboard.

accounts.description: Accounts list of accounts to query the widget data from

category.description: Category the widget is related to. Used to display in widget library under category or dataType if empty.

dataType.description: Data type of the widget. Describes what data does the widget query. supporting data types "incidents","messages","system","entries","tasks", "audit".

description.description: The description of the widget's usage and data representation.

ignoreWorkers.description: Do not use workers mechanism while searching bleve

isPredefined.description: Is the widget a system widget.

locked.description: Is the widget locked for editing.

params.description: Additional parameters for this widget, depends on widget type and data.

prevName.description: The previous name of the widget.

query.description: Query to search on the dataType.

searchAfter.description: Efficient next page, pass max sort value from previous page

searchAfterElastic.description: Efficient next page, pass max ES sort value from previous page

searchAfterMap.description:
Map accounts search after values - stores next page sort values per account.
There is no need to store searchBeforeMap as [current page searchBefore] equals to [prev page searchAfter]
More, there is no way to generate correct searchBefore from current page as some tenants may not appear at all.
The map is relevant in proxy mode and used by tenants, each tenant extracts the searchAfter keys from the map.

searchBefore.description: Efficient prev page, pass min sort value from next page

searchBeforeElastic.description: Efficient prev page, pass min ES sort value from next page

size.description: Size is limited to 1000, if not passed it defaults to 0, and no results will return

skipAggregateAccounts.description: SkipAggregateAccounts flag that indicates whether to skip aggregate accounts results

widgetType.description: Widget type describes how does the widget should recieve the data, and display it. Supporting types: "bar", "column", "pie", "list", "number", "trend", "text", "duration", "image", "line", and "table".

automationScriptFilter.description: automationScriptFilter is a general filter that fetches entities using a query string query using the Query value

searchAfter.description: Efficient next page, pass max sort value from previous page

searchAfterElastic.description: Efficient next page, pass max ES sort value from previous page

More, there is no way to generate correct searchBefore from current page as some tenants may not appear at all.
The map is relevant in proxy mode and used by tenants, each tenant extracts the searchAfter keys from the map.
